item.title: Ukraine war: Russia 'plans to seize southern Ukraine'
item.description: A senior general says the aim is to open a route into a separatist region of Moldova, Transnistria.

item.title: Ukraine war: The Russia I knew no longer exists - Steve Rosenberg
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg takes in the sites of Moscow apparently distorted by the war against Ukraine.

item.title: Afghanistan: Kunduz mosque attacked during Friday prayers
item.description: The deadly explosion comes amid a revival of violence claimed by Islamic State militants.

item.title: Gun deaths were the leading killer of US children in 2020
item.description: Guns have overtaken car crashes as the leading cause of death among young Americans.

item.title: Imran Khan: Inside the huge rally in Lahore for Pakistan's ousted PM
item.description: The former prime minister's narrative of a US-led conspiracy to oust him is resonating with his supporters.

item.title: Mike Tyson punched plane passenger 'after bottle thrown'
item.description: Video shows the former heavyweight boxer repeatedly punching a man in the head.

item.title: #JusticeForSheila: Kenyan anger after lesbian's murder
item.description: People in Kenyan are expressing their upset about LGBTQ discrimination after

item.title: Mariupol steelworks: 'We have wounded and dead inside the bunkers'
item.description: One of the last defenders in Mariupol tells the BBC conditions are dire but they won't surrender.

item.title: Shanghai escalates Covid lockdown restrictions
item.description: The latest measures will include placing door alarms to prevent those infected from leaving.

item.title: Jerusalem holy site clashes fuel fears of return to war
item.description: Tensions are high following several days of violence in and around the al-Aqsa Mosque compound.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard face off in court
item.description: Depp says she stubbed a cigarette on his face. The court sees a Depp text saying: "Lets burn Amber!!!"

item.title: Mwai Kibaki: Kenya's first opposition president dies aged 90
item.description: Mwai Kibaki ended 40 years of one-party rule but his 2007 re-election sparked nationwide violence.

item.title: Kenya's Mwai Kibaki: The hope and disappointment
item.description: Ex-Kenyan President Mwai Kibaki is remembered for ending the stranglehold of the former ruling party.

item.title: Mariupol: Driving into the 'apocalypse' to save mum and dad
item.description: How a young Ukrainian woman travelled into the besieged city of Mariupol to save her parents.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 15-21 April 2022
item.description: A selection of the best photos from across Africa and beyond this week.

item.title: Mid-day meal plan struggles to feed India's hungry students
item.description: The world's most ambitious free school food programme resumes post pandemic, but problems remain.

item.title: Why Argentina is embracing cryptocurrency
item.description: The nation that has seen economic trauma is open to the possibility of alternative money like Bitcoin.

item.title: What weapons has the US given Ukraine - and how much do they help?
item.description: President Biden has announced a new $800m assistance package that includes ammunition and drones.

item.title: Ukraine war: Inside Kyiv's trench defences
item.description: Kyiv's defence force remains on high alert, dug into trenches in case of the return of Russian troops.

item.title: Khodorkovsky: Oil ban would deal Putin ‘very serious blow’
item.description: Exiled Russian tycoon says oil embargo could halve country’s cash and damage Putin’s war capability.

item.title: The German towns in Paraguay with a surge in European immigrants
item.description: Thousands of German nationals have migrated to Paraguay to escape Covid restrictions and immigration in Europe.

item.title: France election: What far-right leader Marine Le Pen said before… and now
item.description: Has Marine Le Pen's strong views on immigration, the EU and Nato shifted since the last election?

item.title: Ukrainians injured or killed by unexploded ammunition
item.description: Across Ukraine’s Kyiv region, efforts have begun to clear the countless pieces of unexploded ammunition left behind after fierce fighting.
